info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-meraki-connect-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions for
     monitoring all parameters of Cloud Monitoring with Meraki Dashboard in a Network Element.
     Copyright (c) 2023-2024 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Other Services
**Paths:** 18

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-meraki-connect-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-meraki-connect-oper.yang)

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-meraki-connect-oper structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-meraki-connect-oper.html)

get.description: Operational data model for Meraki connect
Details of the device registration with Meraki Dashboard
Details of the system progress stage
Details of config monitor process status
Details of config updater notification changes
Details of config updater state machine operations
Details of config monitor notification changes (collection)
Details of config monitor notification changes
Details of config monitor notification changes (collection)
Details of config monitor notification changes

network-name.description: The network name of the device

last-fetch.description: Timestamp of the last Nextunnel configuration fetch

fetch-fail-detail.description: Detail of Nextunnel configuration fetch fails reason

client-last-restart.description: Timestamp of the last client restart

rx-packets.description: Number of packets received by the Nextunnel

tx-packets.description: Number of packets transmitted by the Nextunnel

rx-errors.description: Number of error packets received by the Nextunnel

tx-errors.description: Number of error packets transmitted by the Nextunnel

rx-drop-packets.description: Number of receiving packets dropped by the Nextunnel

tx-drop-packets.description: Number of transmitting packets dropped by the Nextunnel

ni-type.description:
Network instance type. Differentiates between the
         default routing instance and VRFs

ni-name.description:
Network instance name. If the type is
         net-inst-default, the name is not meaningful

meraki-id.description: Meraki ID received from Meraki dashboard

err-detail.description: Error message of the device registration

cloud-id.description: Cloud ID received from Meraki dashboard

Edit config action was performed.
         Reference:
         RFC 6241, edit config

id.description: Config change is assigned a unique ID

xpath-total.description: Actual number of config modifications contained in the config notification

process-state.description: Config updater is currently in this state

next-cfg-save-ts.description: Next config save will happen at this timestamp

save-state.description: The config save operation is currently in this state

cfg-save-done.description: Indicates that a config save operation has finished

req-retry-timeout.description: Amount of time to wait before the next retry of the config updater request to the dashboard

req-is-backoff-timeout.description: Indicates if timeout used in next retry of the config updater request to dashboard is the dashboard response backoff timeout or the default timeout

req-retry-cnt.description: The count of the number of times the config updater to dashboard request has been attempted
